It had been a while since Tucson was involved in a formal mission.  He miss=
ed the days of battling beside his comrades and everything else that went a=
long with being an active Autobot.  Going down onto the old Maximal base wa=
s exactly the opportunity he was looking for, to get back into the program.=
  He raises his right hand, and even though he could not see, his ears were=
 sharp to the sounds around him, no matter how minute they were.

" Count m=
e in Perseus.  It's been a while since I've actually made myself useful.  I=
 may not be able to see, but my hearing well compensates for lack of visual=
 abilities."

Showing now fear, Tucson gives Perseus a grin of assurance, l=
etting him now he was fully confident in his ability to compensate for what=
 he did not have.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> w=
rote:
>
> The old Maximal Base had been abandoned for quite some time; ever=
 since Jhiaxus
> blew down the doors to the base and scattered those inside=
.
> Salveo had been on that team that plucked Windlord, Cup, Nightlight fro=
m the
> battle and chased off the attacker.
> 
> 
> "Bring us around to the=
 front of the structure." said Perseus calmly.
> "We're going to have to ta=
ke a look inside, you never know who may be
> inside.  Do I have any volunt=
eers for the entry team?"
> 
> Guardia raised her hand quietly, looking aro=
und at the other Maximals
> 
> 
> 
> *Tag: All Maximal with Perseus, anyone=
 else that might be on the ground near
> Relay City.*
>
